plenty of *interesting* people coming in though.. and I'll just leave it at that. the bathroom could using some tlc and maybe more toilet paper. the hand dryer is like a monster, probably the best about muddy's, jk.  or not.


p.s. i like this location better than the 16th/val location.
author: Jennie L.

description: Free wireless, cheap deliciosly strong coffee, among the best in SF.  Not a starbucks type of place...so if you're seeking that kind of environment, go elsewhere.  I love and appreciate coffee, so I like Muddy's.  An ecclectic group of people visit the place, including the loyal neighborhood dwellers, myself included.  The staff are cool.  Did I mention free wireless?...
author: Adrian N.

description: I basically came here to kill some time before meeting my friends. It wasn't too crowded for a Sunday.  All I had was a sparkling apple juice! It was a hot day so it hit the spot.  Would I come here again? Probably not. But if I am in the area again and need to kill time...I may just come back...the only thing I liked was that the space was big enough...it's not one of those stuffy cafes...
author: Mel P.

description: Zero atmosphere and cold service but the coffee is just like it should be : like toxic sludge. A must have for when you are trying to drag your ass to work in the morning.
author: Maria D.

description: COMPLETE! This is coffee, dark rich, no frills. And if you are looking for frills sit yourself down for some table top Ms. PacMan. The folks behind the counter move about like gyros in space. Muddy's is also host to some talented artists and photographers. Rough around the edges...somewhat, but it's a solid place that serves its neighborhood well.
author: Travis W.

description: In search of something sweet, I stumbled into this cafe full of people on laptops typing quietly to themselves.  Friendly staff patiently indulged my questions about what to order.  Tried the coffee cake, which was massive but light, not too sweet and crusted with a nice graham cracker/cinnamon mix.  Can't comment on the coffee or anything else, but the ambience was chill and the coffee cake was quite good.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Muddy's very possibly has the worst dressed clientele in the city, and I don't make that comment lightly. However, if you can ignore the stylistically challenged, the grime and the preponderance of creepy old men, they do make decent coffee and a tolerable latte. Staff is super spacey but generally sweet. Great coffee cake.
author: Hayesvalleygirl ..

description:
I can't give it more than two stars since they allow SO much loitering in front of their store. Not like, hey we are hanging out with our friends. Like hey, we are drinking beer in the bag of invisibility and gawking at all the women who walk by. It's enough to make me wish they'd lose their permit for outdoor seating... in fact maybe I'll look into that.

Crappy coffee, decent bagel, always smells like B.O. due to said loiterers.

I routinely walk right by here to get mediocre coffee elsewhere.
author: Mr. Marie T.

description: Decent coffeehouse with a reasonably good ambiance.  Nothing to boast about on Yelp, but a solid choice -- particularly given that it's less than a block away from my house.
author: Victor R.

description:
thank you muddy's for having a few video games!
your coffee is always perfect, the vibe is mellow, the baked goods are like mom would make and the music is just right. 
although i frequent many coffee shops- yours is where i want to read, have a conversation, catch up on what's going on, play a video game or just hang out. 
LOVE YOU!
author: SF U.

description: Pure Mission. Bare bones decor, good coffee, curious art, and a constant flux of eclectic customers makes for a great people watching experience at any time of day or night. More spacious and a lower street person quotient than the sister shop up the street. Free coffee with a bag of beans. Friendly staff, most of whom sport an enviable collection of tattoos. Oh and they have an original Galaxians machine. Wifi isn't free though - zrnet.
author: Stuart J.

description: I'm a fan of this place.  Sure, it's not necessarily gourmet or the most pristine establishment, but they make a damn good cup of coffee.  The place has character, and thus is always crawling with characters.
author: Kerry D.

description: This place rocks! I went there when I was student, but it's still a place where I would like to spend time. The location is perfect : not so far from the BART station. 16th mission.
author: Max R.

description:
stalwart - {stawl-wert} adj. - sturdy and robust; firm, steadfast, uncompromising

Can't we agree that this defines Muddy's. Look, Starbucks for all their chemistry-geek state o'the art mumbo jumbo faux technology to keep their coffee the freshest and at ideal temperatures. Forget it. Muddy's serves strong, bold, uncompromising coffee. Same goes for their decaf even.

And the staff doesn't bulls**t. They know what I drink and they pour it for me when I walk in the door. No drama. No fuss. No compromising. 

Yes, I am a fan.
author: maureen f.

description: Cool name, very mellow atmosphere full of quiet people keeping busy online and playing board games.  They make a nice cup o joe and a yummy bagel, cheese, and egg sandwich.
author: Russ B.

description: I had been here twice before in the past.  Nothing has changed at all.  The space has a nice width compared to most coffeeshops an can handle more people which makes for a nice environment.  Always a bunch of people drinking coffee, reading and using laptops.  I had some reading to do and had some house coffee.  They have good foot traffic and the WiFi worked okay.  It is a nice place.
author: Cush D.

description:
It'll do in a pinch but the city is too full of exceptionally good coffee served in clean, well-staffed cafes to waste time here. Bathrooms are usually filthy, staff seem disengaged and both Valencia St. locations are just plain icky inside. 
Anything good here? Great name, and the chai is very good--peppery and very little sweetness--just the way I learned to like it in Santa Cruz. But get it to go.
author: Jackie C.

description: This was my coffee place when I lived in the Mission (tear, sniff). Well, I guess I miss the city more as a whole than living at 24th and Mission. Anyway, I used to get my pint of black coffee and poppy seed bagel with cream cheese as I read the Comical, I mean Chronicle. They were always super-friendly and worked hard. I wish the South Bay had coffee places besides Starbucks and Pete's. Damn corporate scoundrels!
author: Berg W.

description: I came to review this place and found that i was in complete agreement with the star rating determined by all you other mission yelpers.  That almost never happens.  Solid 3 star coffee joint.  w00t: plenty of seating.  un-w00t: mediocre beverages that are always so hot that I burn my tounge.
author: Melissa Y.

description: I am mystified as to what makes the egg and cheese bagels so good, exactly, but I am so glad that this is close to my apartment, because I probably eat one every single day.
author: Ivy S.

description: Great coffee, and that's what matters.  If you are there on Friday, you might get a glimpse of "Game Night".    Ms. Pacman, internet, and a crazy bathroom that they can buzz you into.  Great coffee, try the brown sugar.
author: Dylan C.

description: OH SHIT I DONT HAVE MY LAP TOP, I BETTER SHUT UP AND NOT BOTHER THOSE JERKS WITH FANCY READERS AND NIFTY PERSONAL COMPUTERS, ILL Drink my coffee on my way outta here...actually ...its fair priced, although the chai tea comes from a plastic jug, but real people drink Coffee beans. Its spacious, worth a visit if your in the area.
author: Joe J.

description: If you call yourself a coffee house, the least you can do is serve drinkable coffee.  Toxic sludge is right.  For some reason they like to keep the door propped open even if it's freezing out.  However, it's completely and utterly free of pretension, which I find refreshing.  And they serve a decent bagel in the mornings, along with piroshkis and cake.
author: Esther K.

description: not the best coffee. not the strongest coffee.......but muddy's is pretty much hipster-free.......and sometimes, that makes all the difference in the world.......or at least, in the mission. so muddy's is where i go for a three star coffee when i don't want to deal with the hipsters at ritual.
author: frisco j.

description: This really is a neighborhood joint.  It can't do wrong by me when it's on my friggen way to work, like I literally have to pass it to get to work.  If I don't get coffee in the morning, it's my fault for waking up too late.  The staff are friendly, they know what the regulars order.  Gaby is sweet and always friendly.  There was this one rocker dude who always seemed grouchy, but I took that as more about him than me.  Even though the coffee is STRONG, as it should be, I've gotten turned onto something else recently -- the name escapes me, but it is basically two shots of espresso in a cup of (already strong) coffee.  Like other things, it's made my tolerence increase.  An hour or so after having one of these cups yesterday, I noticed my heart beating fast, like I could feel it.  I freaked out for a minute, then remembered what I had just finished.  Check it out.  Oh, and I wondered about the crowds of people on weekend nights playing board games:  clean and sober.  It's all good.
author: Emilio O.

description: The only thing that saves this place from one sta... oh wait, this _is_ a one-star place. Crap, crap, crappity, crap. It's dirty. I see people go in late at night to clean, but there's no result as far as I can tell. The staff is cold. As much as I like parlor games, I'm not drawn in at all by the friday night game night. I gave this place a bunch of chances-- it's my next-door coffee shop-- but no dice.
author: Michael S.

description:
said they couldn't toast bagel cause it "would catch on fire"...
only coffee and bagels that were alright..

hard benches and tables, good outlet access..outdoor seating is two tables out front
author: Kate R.

description: but really... don't people just go there for the free internet? cafe quetal is where its at..i only wish they stayed open later.
author: Matthew R.

description: I'm visiting from New York and wanted to check out the area coffee shops. Muddy's is right by where my sister lives. I took a book with me. It's a nice, airy space with lots of tables. The other customers were all reading or on their computers, a cool, diverse group of folks. I bought a bagel with hummus and orange juice. The bagel was served warm and was fresh and the hummus was delicious. The orange juice was also fresh and sweet. I'm here for a week and am going back again tomorrow. And the servers were friendly.
author: Mandy R.

description: The atmosphere is pleasant, and things seem to be decently priced... but I can't give more than 2 stars to a coffee shop with that gives out tea and coffee in paper cups by default. I thought Muddy's didn't even have ceramic mugs until I saw the one person in the place who had one.
author: jenny d.

description: This place sucks. Had some time to kill so walked in to get a caffe latte. It just tasted weird and I didn't finish it. There are so many coffee shops in the area, why bother going to this one?
author: Pablo P.

description: Best coffee I've ever had. My mother in law sends it up to Seattle for me when I'm out. It's my first stop when I travel to San Fransisco. The staff are nice and the locals add color to the place.
author: tim s.
